S.FORM: Tinpitu tukii saak haip tunahaan pasnanava'an.
S.TRANSL: 我今天七點到學校。
I arrived at school at seven today.

S.FORM: Nakitngaa'in mapasnava, mukumbu masnanava munhaan pasnanava'an. Tupa lalavian tu,” Mindangkaza! Masumsuma!",It's time for class
S.TRANSL: and the monitor said: “Stand up! Salute!”"
the teacher walked into the classroom

S.FORM: Tusqit saam tupa tu,” Uninang! Masnanava!",We said loudly
S.TRANSL: teacher.”"
“Hi

S.FORM: Maaq tu maspasnava a, isnava'an saam masnanava malasBunun masisipul.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，老師教我們數字的族語。
In class, the teacher taught us the Bunun language of numbers.

S.FORM: Makilansan saam masnanava masipul, tusuas i masisipul tu sintusaus.
S.TRANSL: 我們跟著老師唸，我們唱了數字歌。
We followed the teacher to read, we sang the number song.

S.FORM: Mapinqansiapin saak madia malasBunun tu qalinga.
S.TRANSL: 我學會好多族語。
I have learned many Bunun languages.

S.FORM: Daqdaqanin saak munhaan pasnanava'an, lusbut mapasnava malasBunun, nabazbaz saak mapatan'a tina.
S.TRANSL: 我天天上學，我天天學族語，我要講給媽媽聽。
I go to school every day, I learn the Bunun language every day, and I want to tell my mother.

S.FORM: Tupa'un inaak ngaan tu Pa'ian.
S.TRANSL: 我的名字是Pa'ian。
My name is Pa'ian.

S.FORM: Tupa'un inaak tama ngaan tu Umas.
S.TRANSL: 我爸爸的名字是Umas。
My dad's name is Umas.

S.FORM: Tupa'un inaak tina ngaan tu Sani.
S.TRANSL: 我媽媽的名字是Sani。
My mother's name is Sani.

S.FORM: Mas'an inaak qamisan laupaku.
S.TRANSL: 我今年10歲。
I am 10 years old.

S.FORM: Haiza inaak tuqasnanaz, tupa'un naipa tu Laung, mas'an qan tas'a qamisan naipa laupaku.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個哥哥，他叫Laung，他今年11歲。
I have a brother, his name is Laung, he is 11 years old.

S.FORM: Muskun inaam tu pasnanava'an.
S.TRANSL: 我們在同一間學校讀書。
We study in the same school.

S.FORM: Mazima saak siin inaak tu tuqasnanaz tusasaus.
S.TRANSL: 我和哥哥都喜歡唱歌。
Both my brother and I like to sing.

S.FORM: Mazima saak sungqaqaul, maaq tu pal'uun a, muskun saam tastulumaq sungqaqaul.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡游泳，放假的時候，我們全家會一起去游泳。
I like swimming. During the holidays, our whole family go swimming together.

S.FORM: Mazima saak mapasaqaal baqlu tu kaviaz, maqtu saam tuskun tusasaus siin muskun sungqaqaul.
S.TRANSL: 我喜歡認識新朋友，我們可以一起唱歌和游泳。
I love meeting new people, we can sing and swim together.

S.FORM: Isia saak Bunun siduq tu uvaz'az.
S.TRANSL: 我是布農族的小孩。
I am an Bunun child.

S.FORM: Takihaan inaam lumaq Salitung.
S.TRANSL: 我們家住在豐丘村。
Our family lives in Salitung.

S.FORM: Hahima saam tastulumaq bunun.
S.TRANSL: 我們家共有五個人。
There are five people in our family.

S.FORM: Tatau saam tastulumaq taisis'aan.
S.TRANSL: 我們家有三個兄弟姊妹。
There are three brothers and sisters in our family.

S.FORM: Muskun saak tama tina tuqasnanaz siin tuqasnau'az.
S.TRANSL: 我跟爸爸、媽媽、哥哥和姊姊住在一起。
I live with my father, mother, brother and sister.

S.FORM: Malaungkav inaak tama, kisacu naipa.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很高，我的爸爸是警察。
My father is tall and he is a policeman.

S.FORM: Makuis inaak tina, Ising naipa.
S.TRANSL: 我的媽媽很瘦，我的媽媽是醫生。
My mother is thin and my mom is a doctor.

S.FORM: MalasBunun tama ihaan lumaq pabazbaz zami.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸在家會和我們說族語。
My father speaks the Bunun language with us at home.

S.FORM: Musuqais saam munhaan asang i pal'uunin.
S.TRANSL: 我們暑假都會回部落。
We will all go back to the tribe during the summer vacation.

S.FORM: Muskun saak inaak tu tais'aan madamu aukauk.
S.TRANSL: 我和兄姊會一起抓青蛙。
My brothers and sisters and I will catch frogs together.

S.FORM: Madaidaz saak inaak tastulumaq tu tais'aan.
S.TRANSL: 我很喜歡我們家的人。
I like our family very much.

S.FORM: taskun saak haip tina munata tantungu.
S.TRANSL: 今天我和媽媽出去玩。
I went out with my mother today.

S.FORM: Mataisqang a diqanin tu qani'anan, nitu makazav, nii amin maklang, kamamakazvav a hivhiv.
S.TRANSL: 白天的天空很晴朗，天氣不冷也不熱，風很涼爽。
The sky is blue during the day, the weather is neither cold nor hot, and the wind is cool.

S.FORM: Ihaan saam masu'ismutan mama'un paang, sanvali'un lutbu taisqang, mastaan tu manangqat.
S.TRANSL: 我們在草地上吃著麵包，陽光灑在身上，非常溫暖。
We ate bread on the grass, the sun was shining on us, and it was very warm.

S.FORM: Tungquvali, mindangqasin a diqanin.
S.TRANSL: 下午，天空變紅了。
In the afternoon, the sky turned red.

S.FORM: Masingav saak tina tu, mavia diqanin tu mindangqasin i?
S.TRANSL: 我問媽媽，為甚麼天空是紅色的？
I asked my mother why the sky is red.

S.FORM: Tupa tina tu, lau naminsuma'in balivusan.
S.TRANSL: 媽媽說，可能是颱風要來了。
Mom said, maybe the typhoon is coming.

S.FORM: Uka luhum ihaan diqanin tu sanavan, minsuma'in a bintuqan.
S.TRANSL: 晚上天上沒有雲，星星出來了。
There were no clouds in the sky at night, and the stars came out.

S.FORM: Namulumaqin amin saam.
S.TRANSL: 我們也要回家了。
We were going home too.

S.FORM: Ihaan mulumaq tu inundadanan, masisaupa saak bintuqan tukas'aang.
S.TRANSL: 在回家的路上，我跟星星許願。
On the way home, I made a wish with the stars,

S.FORM: Maqtu'ang balivusan nitu mun'iti, asa'ang saak munata tantungu.
S.TRANSL: 希望颱風不要來，我還想再出去玩。
I hope the typhoon doesn't come, I still want to go out to play again.

S.FORM: Inaak pasnanava'an qai, ihaan inaam lumaq tu dingalan, daqdaqanin saak kanbantas munhaan pasnanava'an, kanbantas amin mulumaq.
S.TRANSL: 我的學校在我們家旁邊，我天天走路去學校，也走路回家。
My school is next to our house, I walk to school every day, and I also walk home.

S.FORM: Nii inaam pasnanava'an madaing, nitu papia isnanava'an, mapasaqaal amin saam.
S.TRANSL: 我們學校不大，沒有很多學生，大家互相認識。
Our school is not big, there are not many students, everyone knows each other.

S.FORM: Mudinuun amin isnanava'an ihaan tindangkulan, muskun pismamali, tuskun pababazbaz.
S.TRANSL: 所有小朋友會聚在操場，一起玩球、一起聊天。
All the children will gather in the playground, play ball and chat together.

S.FORM: Muskun amin saam inaam tu masnanava pistanaqtaq. Maszang a pasnanava'an tastulumaqan.
S.TRANSL: 老師們也會和我們一起玩，學校是個大家庭。
The teachers also play with us, the school is one big family.

S.FORM: Daqdaqanin saam ma'a'asik, muskun mapiningzav i pasnava'an.
S.TRANSL: 我們每天都要打掃，大家要把教室打掃乾淨。
We have to clean every day, and everyone has to clean the classroom.

S.FORM: Haiza bunun maqaisqais i vanaas tu tidanuman, haiza bunun ma'asik.
S.TRANSL: 有些人去擦窗戶，有些人去掃地。
Some people clean the windows, some sweep the floor.

S.FORM: Asikun zami pasnanava'an tu isaq'isaq, mapa'uskun kuzakuza, daqdaqanin maningzav amin a pasnanava'an.
S.TRANSL: 我們還會打掃學校的各個角落，大家分工合作，學校每天都很乾淨。
We will also clean every corner of the school. Everyone works together, and the school is very clean every day.

S.FORM: Takna, munhaan saak qudas tantungu.
S.TRANSL: 昨天，我去部落拜訪爺爺。
Yesterday, I went to visit my grandpa in the tribe.

S.FORM: Talmadia'in saam nitu mapasaduu, matusalpu saak istaa.
S.TRANSL: 我們很久沒有見面了，我很想念他。
We haven't seen each other for a long time and I miss him a lot.

S.FORM: Maaq tu sadu'an saak qudas, pakaunan saak suika, paqudan saak savil.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺一看到我，就請我吃西瓜，請我喝茶。
As soon as grandpa saw me, he invited me to eat watermelon and drink tea.

S.FORM: Madavus isia qudas sinsuaz tu suika, tutuza tu manambuq kaunun.
S.TRANSL: 爺爺種的西瓜很甜，真的很好吃。
The watermelon grown by grandpa is very sweet and really delicious.

S.FORM: Maduu amin saak quu dudas tu savil. masihal amin qudan.
S.TRANSL: 我也喜歡爺爺的茶，也很好喝。
I also like grandpa's tea, it's tasted good too.

S.FORM: Maaq tu tungquvali, muskun saak qudasnau'az mapit'ia paitutungquvali.
S.TRANSL: 中午的時候，我和奶奶一起煮午餐。
At noon, I cooked lunch with my grandma.

S.FORM: Madia isia qudasnau'az sinpit'ia paitutunguvali, haiza iskaan, haiza maitulkuk, haiza bahat, haizang ciqutciqut.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶煮了很豐盛的午餐，有魚、有雞、有南瓜、還有蝸牛。
Grandma cooked a big lunch, including fish, chicken, pumpkin, and snails.

S.FORM: Maaq tu mina'unin paitutungquvali ka, munhaan saam pitsanglavan matingus sanglav.
S.TRANSL: 吃完午餐後，我們去菜園摘菜。
After lunch, we went to the vegetable garden to pick vegetables.

S.FORM: Madia isia qudas siniza tu hutan tai siin tulkum pinaak, nadasun zaku mulumaq.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶拿了很多地瓜、芋頭和蕗蕎給我，要我帶回家。
Grandma brought me a lot of sweet potatoes, taro and buckwheat, and asked me to take them home.

S.FORM: Mapalavaaz saak intaa, tupa tu namuqna ata mapasaduu.
S.TRANSL: 我跟他們道別，說下次再去看他們。
I said goodbye to them and said I'd see them next time.

S.FORM: Haip tu qani'anan, dasun saam masnanava munhaan sasaipukan takismumuut, ihaan saam hilav maldailaz baliv kipu.
S.TRANSL: 今天老師帶我們去動物園，我們在門口排隊買票。
Today the teacher took us to the zoo, and we lined up at the gate to buy tickets.

S.FORM: Maaq tu mukumbu'in saam a, tupa masnanava tu,” Antanngaus qai saipukan qazam, antanhiku qai saipukan ivut, anaka amin amu saduduu.",After entering the zoo
S.TRANSL: "There are birds in the front and snakes in the back
the teacher said

S.FORM: Mapising saak ivut, paaqpun nii saak saduu ivut.
S.TRANSL: 我會怕蛇，所以我不看蛇類。
I'm afraid of snakes, so I don't look at snakes.

S.FORM: Sinaduu'in saak madia tu qazam, ihaan aingka lukis daza kusbabai, haiza tuquu ihaan lukis tu luak malsasabaq.
S.TRANSL: 我看到了很多鳥，他們在樹上飛來飛去，還有看到貓頭鷹在樹洞裡睡覺。
I saw a lot of birds flying around in the trees and saw owls sleeping in tree hollows.

S.FORM: Haiza ihaan sasaipukan takismumuut kumbu zuu, tas'asikis siin lai'iung, nii saak sinaduu maupata tu takismumuut. Manahip is'aang tu sinaduu'in haip tu qani'anan.
S.TRANSL: 動物園裡有大象、馬和老虎，我從前沒有看過這些動物，今天看到了真的很開心。
There are elephants, horses and tigers in the zoo. I have never seen these animals before. I was really happy to see them today.

S.FORM: Siniza'in saak madia tu qaningu, ispasaduu inaak tu tama tina.
S.TRANSL: 我拍了很多照片，給爸爸媽媽看。
I took a lot of pictures and showed them to my parents.

S.FORM: Maaki muqnin a, nataskun saak tama tina mun'ita.
S.TRANSL: 下次要跟爸爸媽媽一起來。
Next time I will come with my parents.

S.FORM: Haip tu ail'uan, taskun saak tuqasnau'az munhaan Taitu mintivi pantama'un.
S.TRANSL: 這個假日，我和姊姊去台東拜訪叔叔。
This holiday, my sister and I went to Taitung to visit my uncle.

S.FORM: Misnahaan saam Taihuku tunkisia munhaan Taitu.
S.TRANSL: 我們從台北搭火車去臺東。
We took the train from Taipei to Taitung.

S.FORM: Tunahaanin Taitu, ma'unting pantama'un laihli munhaan pandudu'an laihli antala zami.
S.TRANSL: 到了台東，叔叔開車來車站接我們。
When we arrived in Taitung, my uncle drove to the station to pick us up.

S.FORM: Nitu daqvisan isia pantama'unta tu lumaq, muhiav ma'untaing laihli ka tunadiipin.
S.TRANSL: 車站離叔叔家沒有很遠，開車一下子就到了。
The station is not far from my uncle's house, and it's just a short drive away.

S.FORM: Haiza ihaan pantama'un tu lumaq dingalan madaing patankaunan tu bukzavan, taskun saam tunsuzainsia munhaan bukzavanta.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔家附近有個很大的牧場，我們一起騎腳踏車到牧場。
There is a big ranch near my uncle's house, and we rode bicycles to the ranch together.

S.FORM: Ihaan patankaunan tu bukzavan, dasun saam pantama'un paka'un sidih siin tuntas'asikis.
S.TRANSL: 在牧場，叔叔帶我們餵羊和騎馬。
In the ranch, my uncle took us to feed the sheep and ride horses.

S.FORM: Sanavan, muskun saam munhaan Puut tu asang ma'un qaising.
S.TRANSL: 晚上，我們一起去市區吃飯。
In the evening, we went to the city to have dinner together.

S.FORM: Madia ihaan Puut tu asang laihli, paaqpun tundaza saam utuvai mun'ita.
S.TRANSL: 市區車子很多，所以我們騎摩托車去那裡。
There are a lot of cars in the city, so we go there by motorcycle.

S.FORM: Maaq tu namudaanin saam a, tangqa'iunin inaam tu utuvai, muhazin saam tunlaihli musuqais.
S.TRANSL: 要離開的時候，發現摩托車被偷了，我們只好搭公車離開。
When we were about to leave, we found that the motorcycle had been stolen, so we had to leave by bus.

S.FORM: Musuqaisin saam laupaku munhaan Taihuku, nitu niapun tu, lau ukilimanin isia pantama'unta tu utuvai.
S.TRANSL: 現在我們回到台北了，不知道叔叔的摩托車找到了沒有。
Now that we are back in Taipei, I don't know if my uncle's motorcycle has been found.

S.FORM: Maaq tu uvaz'azang saak a, takihaan saak Naihumpu. Maaq tu isnava'anin saak a, mulusqu munhaan Huli, takihaanin amin bukzavan miqumis.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我們家住在內茅埔，上學以後，就搬到了埔里，一直在都市裡生活。
When we were young, our family lived in Naihumpu. After I started school, we moved to Puli and have been living in the city ever since.

S.FORM: Maaq tu ihaanin saak zaingaku isnava'an a, isnava'an saak pali'uni Takisilazan miniqumis tu kainqansiapan, maqansiap tu, haiza takihaan Taivangti Takisilazan miniqumis madia makitvaivi tu iniqumisan.
S.TRANSL: 上了大學以後，我修了一堂關於原住民文化的課程，瞭解到臺灣原住民族有各式各樣豐富的文化。
After I went to college, I took a course on aboriginal culture and learned that the aboriginal people in Taiwan have various and rich cultures.

S.FORM: Paaqpu, maaq tu pal'uunin a, muskun saak inaak tuqasnanaz munhaan asang kilim madadaingaz tantungu, asa pinqansiap anak'anak siduq iniqumisan tu kaitaiklasan.
S.TRANSL: 因此，今年暑假時，我和哥哥回到部落訪問老人家，想要瞭解自己族群的文化。
So this summer, my brother and I went back to our tribe to visit the elderly, hoping to understand the culture of our own ethnic group.

S.FORM: Mavau'unin qamisan a madaingaza, qaitu, maszangang talmaiduu'ang sadu'an.
S.TRANSL: 老人家已經八十歲了，但是看起來還像中年人。
The old man is already eighty years old, but he still looks like a middle-aged man.

S.FORM: Singavun zaku tu piaq isiata qalinga qansiapun? Madauzung naipa malasBunun, maqtu amin malasPuut siin malasLipuun pababazbaz.
S.TRANSL: 我問他會哪些語言，他的布農語說得很流利，也會說閩南語和日本話。
I asked him which languages he knew, and he was fluent in Bunun, as well as Hokkien and Japanese.

S.FORM: Maaq tu singavunin a, tudiipin saak maqansiap tu, misnahaan naipa uvaz'azang isnava'an malasLipuun, binanau'az qai Bunun. Maaq tu kuzakuza naipa qai, mapasaqaal madia tu Puut. Paaqpun, madia isiata qansiapun qalinga isbabazbaz.
S.TRANSL: 我問他才知道，原來他小時候就學日本話，太太是布農族人，而他工作上認識許多閩南家人，所以他會說這麼多語言。
I asked him to find out that he learned Japanese when he was a child, his wife is an Bunun, and he knows many Hokkien at work, so he can speak so many languages.

S.FORM: Maaq tu tantungu saam a, madia isia madaingazta isbazbaz pali'uni qanup tu kaitiklasan.
S.TRANSL: 我們訪談的時候，老人家談論了許多關於狩獵的傳統知識。
During our interview, the old man talked about a lot of traditional knowledge about hunting.

S.FORM: Anatupa tu nii a qalinga aminun zaku itqaal tan'a ka, langati makusia saam ima-zingva siza qaningu, namaqtu'ang uqna'un ikmantukun tan'a.
S.TRANSL: 雖然我們沒有辦法完全聽懂，但是我們有用手機錄影，可以再仔細聆聽。
Although we could't fully understand it, we could record it on our cell phones and listen to it more.

S.FORM: Nii saak matlaz maqansiap anak'anak iniqumisan tu uvavaz'azang, matukaz'av tu anak'anak qai Takisilazan tu miniqumis.
S.TRANSL: 小時候我不瞭解自己族群的文化，對於自己是原住民有點不好意思。
When I was young, I didn't understand the culture of my ethnic group, and I was a little embarrassed that I was an aborigine.

S.FORM: Maaq tu madia'in inaak qansiapun a, haiza'in iniliskinan tu Bunun saak, makitvaivi tu bunun, haiza'an amin maqtu iskukuniv tu kaitaikladsan.
S.TRANSL: 瞭解愈多以後，愈覺得自己身為[布農族]人，是很獨特的，也很值得驕傲。
The more I know, the more I feel that being a Bunun is unique and something to be proud of.

S.FORM: Maaq haip tu dalavdav a, namusuqaisin naubahbnanaz mulumaq.
S.TRANSL: 今天傍晚，弟弟就要回家了。
My younger brother is going home this evening.

S.FORM: Muskun saak qudasnau'az munhaan babalivan mabaliv tulkuk, mapalsanus mapit'ia manambuq tu kakaunun ispaka'un naubahnanaz.
S.TRANSL: 我和奶奶去市場買雞，準備煮好吃的晚餐給弟弟。
My grandma and I went to the market to buy chickens and prepared a delicious dinner for my younger brother.

S.FORM: Maaq tu angqai saam babalivan sanglav a, madia ihaan babalivan laupang siniza tu sanglav.
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了菜攤，菜攤有好多新鮮的青菜。
We passed the vegetable stand, which had a lot of fresh green vegetables.

S.FORM: mabaliv saam sanglav, bahat siin tau'las-dangqas.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了空心菜、南瓜和胡蘿蔔。
We bought water spinach, yams and carrots.

S.FORM: Andingalan babalivan kakaunun tu bunun tupa tu,“ Madavus inaak tu bunglai siin qalup, mabaliva tu tikis.”
S.TRANSL: 旁邊水果攤的老闆說:「我的鳳梨和桃子很甜，買一些吧!」
The owner of the nearby fruit stand said: “My pineapples and peaches are very sweet. Buy some!”

S.FORM: Mabalivin saam bunglai siin qalup.
S.TRANSL: 我們買了鳳梨和桃子。
We bought pineapples and peaches.

S.FORM: Angqai saam babalivan titi, tupa Taukii tu,“ Ma'aq isuu nabalivun? Masmuq tu madaing a haip tu maitulkuk, tas'a qai tau sabah sui.”
S.TRANSL: 我們經過了肉攤，老闆說:「你要買什麼?今天的雞又大又肥，一隻300元。」
We passed the meat stall, and the boss said, “What do you want to buy? Today's chickens are big and fat, and one is 300 NTD.”

S.FORM: Tupa qudas tu mastaan maqlis, tusingav Taukii tu, lau maqtu vanaqan tu tikis sui.
S.TRANSL: 奶奶覺得太貴了，問老闆可不可以便宜一點。
Grandma thought it was too expensive and asked the boss if it could be cheaper.

S.FORM: Qaitu, tupa Taukii tu nitu maqlis, ni'in maqtu vanaqan sui.
S.TRANSL: 但老闆說已經很便宜，不能再減了。
But the boss said that it is already very cheap and cannot be reduced any further.

S.FORM: Tupa ka andingalan tu Taukii tu, mabaliva inaak tu iskaan, madaing a iskaan a, nitu maqlis.
S.TRANSL: 隔壁的老闆說，來買我的魚，我的魚又大又便宜。
The boss next door said, come and buy my fish, my fish is big and cheap.

S.FORM: Kinuzin a, mabalivin saam maitulkuk siin iskaan, musuqais mulumaq mapit'ia tastu pangka tu pan'ai'an.
S.TRANSL: 最後我們買了雞也買了魚，回家煮了一桌子的菜。
In the end we bought chicken and fish, and went home to cook a table of food.

S.FORM: Talbuntu'in mantatala, isdumdumin a diqanin.
S.TRANSL: 等了好久，天已經黑了。
After waiting for a long time, it was already dark.

S.FORM: Patunpaklis naubahnanaz tupa tu, musqa sivitai nitu maqtu pal'uun, nahaanin muqnin tu islungu'an tudiip maqtu musuqais.
S.TRANSL: 弟弟打電話回來說，軍隊突然不能放假了，要下一個禮拜日才回來。
The younger brother called back and said that the army suddenly couldn't take a vacation and would not be back until the next Sunday.

S.FORM: Tupa qudasnau'az tu, madia a sinpit'ia, luklasi amin tastulumaq tu tais'aan kuskun ma'un!
S.TRANSL: 奶奶說已經煮了這麼多，叫大家一起來吃吧!
Grandma said that she has cooked so much, so let's eat together!

S.FORM: Tan'ali saam madia tu taisis'aan, kuskun ma'un manambuq paitusanavan tu kakaunun.
S.TRANSL: 我們邀請了親朋好友，一起來享用豐盛的晚餐。
We invited friends and family to have a great dinner together.

S.FORM: Haiza inaak tatini u'uskunan tupa'un tu Tiang, lusbut naipa panpupungul madas ikma'ai'un.
S.TRANSL: 我有一個同學叫Tiang，他常常忘記帶東西。
I have a classmate named Tiang, he often forgets to bring things.

S.FORM: Maaki isnava'an a, simul naipa u'uskunan ispapatas, isqaqaisqais nait patasan.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，他跟同學借鉛筆、橡皮擦或是筆記本。
During class, he borrowed pencils, erasers or notebooks from his classmates.

S.FORM: Mus'an mupusan muti'un, tudiip saam mapasimul istaa.
S.TRANSL: 一次、兩次、三次，大家會借東西給他。
Once, twice, three times, everyone would lend him something.

S.FORM: Qaitu, madikla naipa i, lusbut simul ikma'ai'un a nitu masuqais sinimulan.
S.TRANSL: 但是他有個壞習慣，經常借了東西卻不還。
But he has a bad habit of often borrowing things but not returning them.

S.FORM: Kinuzin, ni'in amin saam asa mapasimul istaa ikma'ai'un.
S.TRANSL: 最後大家都不想借他東西了。
In the end, no one wanted to borrow anything from him.

S.FORM: Haiza tu tastudiqanin, muskun saam munhaan bukzavan tantungu.
S.TRANSL: 有一天，我們大家一起去郊遊。
One day, we all went on an outing together.

S.FORM: Ihaan inundadanan, asa Tiang munhaan pattaki'an, qaitu, panpungul naipa madas isqaqaisqais tu haqil.
S.TRANSL: 路途中，Tiang想上廁所，但他忘記帶衛生紙。
On the way, Tiang wanted to go to the bathroom, but he forgot to bring toilet paper.

S.FORM: Masaupa naipa u'uskunan simul isqaqaisqais tu haqil, qaitu, antalam amin saam tu, nii amin minadas.
S.TRANSL: 他跟同學借衛生紙，可是大家都回他說，我也沒有帶耶。
He borrowed toilet paper from his classmates, but everyone told him that I didn't bring them either.

S.FORM: Tin'iangiang a Tiang tatangis, masuqnuq naipa tupa tu, “Mavia amu tu nitu mapasimul zaku isqaqaisqais tu haqil i!”
S.TRANSL: Tiang急的哭了出來。他生氣的說，為什麼大家都不借我衛生紙!
Tiang aw burst into tears. He said angrily, why don't everyone lend me toilet paper!

S.FORM: Tupa ka u'uskunan istaa tu, “Maupa i nii asu ana'anak madas a, musasuu tu, mapasimul saam su'u ikma'ai'un a, nii amin asu masuqais.”
S.TRANSL: 同學告訴他，因為你都不自己帶，而且借給你的東西，你都不會還!
The classmate told him, because you didn't bring it yourself, and you wouldn't return the things lent to you!

S.FORM: Maaq tu laqbingin a, matingmut a Tiang munhaan pasnanava'an, suqaisun amin sinimul Tiang tu ikma'ai'un pisia u'uskunan.
S.TRANSL: 隔天上學，Tiang很早就到學校了，Tiang把跟同學借的東西都還給同學們。
The next day at school, Tiang arrived at school early and returned everything he had borrowed from his classmates.

S.FORM: Matukaz'av Tiang masisaupa u'uskunan bazbaz tu, na'anak'in naipa qabasin madas ikma'ai'un. Matumasqing amin naipa u'uskunan tu, mituza qabas mapasimul istaa ikmama'ai'un.
S.TRANSL: Tiang向同學們道歉，並說他以後一定會自己帶東西，也謝謝同學們之前願意借他東西。
Tiang apologized to the students and said that he would definitely bring his own things in the future, and thanked the classmates for their willingness to lend him things before.

S.FORM: Inaak tu tama qai, takihaan asang qaqanup tu mamangan.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸是部落的獵人。
My dad is a hunter of the tribe.

S.FORM: Maaq tu uvaz'azang saak ka, muskun tama siin pantama'un sanavan munata, madas i via siin busul.
S.TRANSL: 我小的時候，爸爸和叔叔會在晚上出門，帶著獵刀和獵槍。
When I was little, my dad and uncle would go out at night with hunting knives and guns.

S.FORM: Maaq tu tusqangin diqanin a, madas naingka qinanup tu titi musuqais.
S.TRANSL: 天亮時，他們就會帶著獵到的獵物回來。
At daybreak, they returned with their prey.

S.FORM: Mintun sia vanis, mintun sia haval, minitun amin haiza linas.
S.TRANSL: 有時候是山豬、有時候是飛鼠，偶爾也會有雉雞。
Sometimes it was a boar, sometimes a flying squirrel, and occasionally a pheasant.

S.FORM: Pisihalun intaa ihaan lumaq mapaqusil titi, ispaququsil i taisis'aan.
S.TRANSL: 他們會在家裡將獵物分好，分享給族人。
They would divide the prey at the entrance of the village and share it with the tribe.

S.FORM: Lusbuq saak tupa tama tu, asa makilansan tama qanup.
S.TRANSL: 我每次都會吵著爸爸，要跟著爸爸去打獵。
Every time I quarreled with my father, I wanted to go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: Tupa tama zaku tu, maaki taldaingin saak a, tudiipin madas zaku munludun.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說等我長大了他再帶我一起去。
Dad said that he would take me with me when I grew up.

S.FORM: Takihaan asang tu maiduduaz, maqansiap amin makusia haqu madamu takismumuut. Matas'i naingka lismusqut siin labantiq tu haqu.
S.TRANSL: 部落的男人也會用陷阱抓獵物，他們會製作套索陷阱和石壓式陷阱。
The men of the tribe also trap their prey, making lasso traps and rock traps.

S.FORM: Maqansiap inaak tama matas'i lismusqut tu sinpalasung.Tupa tama tu, iskusia naipi madamu linas, asa ata tu matqas masailang takismumuut tu dinapan. Maaq a sinpalasung tu haqu qai, asa tu pihanun takimumuut nalaqaiban tu daan.
S.TRANSL: 我的爸爸很會製作套索陷阱，爸爸說，這是用來捕抓雉雞的，我們要仔細觀察獵物的腳印，陷阱要放在獵物走的路上。

My dad is very good at making lasso traps. Dad said that this is used to catch pheasants. We have to carefully observe the footprints of the prey, and the traps should be placed on the path of the prey.

S.FORM: Tis'uni saak asa mahiav taskun madadaingaz munludun qaqanup, daqdaqanin saak pinanaam matas'i haqu. Muhiav a, namaqtu'in inaak sintas'i tu haqu, tutuza tu udamu'an i takismumuut.
S.TRANSL: 為了可以趕快和大人一起去打獵，我每天練習製作陷阱，很快地我的陷阱就真的可以抓到獵物了。
In order to go hunting with adults as soon as possible, I practiced making traps every day, and soon my traps can really catch prey.

S.FORM: Sinaduu'in tama inaak tu sintas'i ka, tupa naipa zaku tu, namin'uni saak qabasin mamangan tu qaqanup.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸看到後對我說我以後一定會是很厲害的獵人。
Dad saw it and told me that I will be a very good hunter in the future.

S.FORM: Laupaku, taldaingin saak, mama saak inaak tu busul-kavi siin kuus, makilansan tama munhaan ludun qanup.
S.TRANSL: 現在我長大了，我背起我的弓和箭矢，跟著爸爸一起去打獵。
Now that I have grown up, I carry my bow and arrows and go hunting with my father.

S.FORM: Maaq tu musiqais munhaan asang qai, mapaqusil qinanup tu titi pisia taisis'aan.
S.TRANSL: 回村時將獵到的獵物和族人們分享。
When returning to the village, share the hunted prey with the tribe.

S.FORM: Tupa tama tu, “Asa ata tu matumasqing maimadadaingaz tu sintuqumis, mintuza ata uqanupan i madia tu sinpapanaq.”
S.TRANSL: 爸爸說，我們要感謝祖靈賜福，讓我們有很多獵物收穫。
Dad said, we want to thank the ancestors for their blessings, so that we have a lot of prey to harvest.

S.FORM: Halasan azak haip tu tingmut munhaan pasnanava'an.
S.TRANSL: 我早上上學遲到了。
I was late for school this morning.

S.FORM: Maaq tu tunahaan azak pasnanava'an qai, panpungul azaK madas kavaang.
S.TRANSL: 去學校的時候，我忘了帶書包。
When I was going to school, I forgot to bring my backpack.

S.FORM: Nii azak minadas ma'aqma'aq tu qaimangsut.
S.TRANSL: 我什麼東西都沒有帶。
I didn't bring anything with me.

S.FORM: Maaq tu isnava'an azak qai, muskun azak u'uskunan saduu patasan.
S.TRANSL: 上課的時候，我和同學一起看課本。
During class, I and my classmates read the textbook together.

S.FORM: Maaq tu palatanam mapatas qai, pasimulan azak u'uskunan ispapatas siin isqaqaisqais.
S.TRANSL: 考試的時候，同學借我筆和橡皮擦。
During the exam, a classmate lent me a pen and an eraser.

S.FORM: Tupa'un azak masnanava tu, “Tingmuta muqnin min'anuqu, kaa'in halasan!",The teacher told me
S.TRANSL: 老師跟我說：「下次早點起床，不要再遲到了!」
"Wake up earlier next time and don't be late again!""

S.FORM: Inaak kaviaz qai tupa'un tu Talum, isia amin naipa Bunun siduq tu uvaz'az.
S.TRANSL: 我的好朋友叫Talum，他也是布農族的小孩。
My good friend's name is Talum, and he is also an Bunun child.

S.FORM: Muskun azam ihaan Izukan tu asang masisipul patasan.
S.TRANSL: 我們一起在卓溪崙天部落讀書。
We study together in the Izukan tribe.

S.FORM: Masiqailis azam muskun tan'a madadaingaz taqu paliqabasan, maqansiap amin azam malasBunun.
S.TRANSL: 我們常常一起聽耆老說故事，我們都很會說布農語。
We often listen to the elders telling stories together, and we both can speak the Bunun proficiently.

S.FORM: Malaungkav azak tu masmuq amin, manisnis makuis a Talum.
S.TRANSL: 我很高也很胖，Talum很矮也很瘦。
I am tall and overweight, while Talum is short and thin.

S.FORM: Matanaqtaq a Talum, mazima amin azam istaa.
S.TRANSL: Talum很有活力，大家都很喜歡他。
Talum is very energetic, and everyone likes him a lot.

S.FORM: Haip qai isia pasnanava'an paintataiv tu qani'anan, papia ka inhamu'un tu paintataiv.
S.TRANSL: 今天是學校的運動會，學校舉辦了許多競賽。
Today was the school's sports day, and the school organized many competitions.

S.FORM: Haiza pasibutbut, kantundaq mali, tindangkul, uluzi siin manaq busul-kavi.
S.TRANSL: 有拔河、足球、跑步、跳舞和射箭。
There were tug of war, soccer, running, dancing, and archery.

S.FORM: Minhamu azak tindangkul tu paintataiv.
S.TRANSL: 我比賽跑步。
I participated in the running competition.

S.FORM: Maaq tu tindangkul azak a, tiskapat azak, madia ihaan buqtung tu qaidang mutaul.
S.TRANSL: 當我跑步的時候，我跌倒了，膝蓋流了很多血。
When I was running, I fell down, and my knees were bleeding.

S.FORM: Qaitu mindangkaz azak, maldauk masaupa tanangaus tindangkul.
S.TRANSL: 但我站起來，繼續向前跑。
But I stood up and continued running forward.

S.FORM: Maaq tu tunahaan azak panatpu'an qai, manahip amin a sikaupa tu bunun.
S.TRANSL: 我到終點時，所有人都很開心。
Everyone was happy when I reached the finish line.

S.FORM: Ananatupa tu nii azak makitngangaus tindangkul, qaitu manahip azak, maupa'i pankanaqtungin azak paintataiv.
S.TRANSL: 雖然沒有獲得第一名，但我很高興，因為我完成了比賽。
Although I didn't get first place, I'm glad because I completed the race.

S.FORM: Taskun azak takna tama munhaan inaak tu pantama'un tantungu.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我和爸爸去拜訪我的叔叔。
Yesterday, my father and I visited my uncle.

S.FORM: Milu'lu'in isia pantama'un tu bantas.
S.TRANSL: 叔叔的腳受傷了。
My uncle injured his foot.

S.FORM: Tupa'un azam istaa tu, haiza ihaan tavi mubuat tu luak.
S.TRANSL: 他告訴我們，房子的屋頂破了一個洞。
He told us that there was a hole in the roof of his house.

S.FORM: Maaq tu minkangna naipa tavi qai, misnahaan tavi mutingkul pananastu.
S.TRANSL: 他在修理屋頂時，從屋頂摔下來了。
He fell off the roof while repairing it.

S.FORM: Madas tama ki maiqanvang tu titi siin saviki isaiv inaak tu pantama'un.
S.TRANSL: 爸爸帶了牛肉和檳榔給叔叔。
My father brought beef and betel nuts for my uncle.

S.FORM: Muskun azak pantama'un ihaan sapalan pababazbaz, taqu naipa madia paliqabasan tu sintataqu.
S.TRANSL: 我和叔叔在房間裡聊天，他分享了很多故事。
My uncle and I chatted in the room, and he shared many stories.

S.FORM: Maaq tu namudaanin azak qai, tumasqingun azak pantama'un tu malaungkavin, talmainduu'in amin sadu'an.
S.TRANSL: 我要離開前，叔叔誇我長高了，也變得更帥氣了。
Before I left, my uncle praised me for growing taller and becoming more handsome.

S.FORM: Tupa azak tu, “Maaki mindaduu'in pantama'un tu bantas a, munhaana amin inaam tu lumaq tantungu ki muqnin.”
S.TRANSL: 我說：「等叔叔腳好了，下次也來我們家玩。」
I said, “When your foot gets better, come to our house next time and visit us.”

S.FORM: Ihaan 2022 tu painsanan, tis'uni Sehu maqtu ihaan Mivunsiu sinpatas tu ngaan “pantas'aun malasBunun tu ngaan mapatas” tu sinkuzakuza mu'ampuk mapaliqansiap.
S.TRANSL: 在2022年，政府召開了原住民身分證可單列族名的會議。
In 2022, the government announced that indigenous identification cards can include tribal names separately.

S.FORM: Mintivi azak malibuntu'in masisaupa Sehu makas'aang tu, maqtu a ihaan Mivunsiu sinpatas tu ngaan “pantas'aun malasBunun tu ngaan mapatas” sinkuzakuza tu maindudu'az Taupa Suqluman.
S.TRANSL: 我訪問了長期向政府爭取身分證「單列族名」的部落青年Taupas Suqluman。
I interviewed Taupas Suqluman, a young tribal member who has long been advocating for the inclusion of tribal names on identification cards.

S.FORM: Mapatupa'in azam tu na'ihaan haip tu islungqu'an tu diqanin munhaan isiata tu lumaq mintivi istaa.
S.TRANSL: 我和他約定好這個假日到他家訪問他。
We had arranged to visit his home this holiday for the interview.

S.FORM: Maaq tu mintivi azak istaa qai, masisaupa naipa zaku mapinqansiap isiata sinpatingaan tu kanada'an, madas amin zaku mapasaqaal isiata tu tastulumaqan, isiata al'asangan tu asang.
S.TRANSL: 在訪問的過程中，他向我介紹了他的名字的由來，也帶我認識了他的家人、他的部落。
During the interview, he introduced to me the origin of his name and also introduced me to his family and tribe.

S.FORM: Tusingavun zaku naipa tu, mavia tu malmananu sisasaa tupa tu, asa sinpatas ngaan tu inkangna'an mapatas, nii qu qabas sinpatas tu ngaan masihal?
S.TRANSL: 我問他為什麼堅持要改名，舊的登記方式不好嗎?
I asked him why he insisted on changing his name. Wasn't the old registration method sufficient?

S.FORM: Tupa naipa zaku tu, maaki makusia malasTauluu tu ngaan mapatas qai, nii tu maqtu pitqas tumantuk isiata nanu tu ngaan, haiza'ang bunun tungaan luklas zaku tu “大先生”, tutuza tu min'uni paqainanan tu sinkuzakuza.
S.TRANSL: \" which resulted in many jokes being made."
He told me that using Chinese characters could not accurately convey his name, and others would still call him \Da Xian Sheng

S.FORM: Tupa Taupas Suqluman tu, “Maaq a sinpatas malasBunun tu ngaan qai, siata nanu inaam mamantuk tu ngaan. Maaq inaak tu ngaan qai mapitqas inaam tu tastusiduqan, inaam tu tastulumaqan, taki'isaq azam tu miniqumis, maqtu'ang malalabas tu taisis'aan maqtu sisuqais anak'anak tu ngaan.”
S.TRANSL: our family
Taupas Suqluman said, \The names written in indigenous languages are our true names. My name represents our ethnic group

S.FORM: Muskun azak qudasnau'az takna munhaan babalivan mapabaliv sanglav, madas a qudasnau'az madia kain'anakan masuaz tu sanglav, matas'i amin madia manambuq tu kakaunun ispaka'un taisis'aan.
S.TRANSL: 昨天我跟奶奶去市集擺攤，奶奶帶了許多自己種的蔬菜去，也製作了原住民美食給大家。
Yesterday, I went to the market with my grandmother to set up a stall. My grandmother brought a lot of vegetables that she grew herself and also prepared indigenous cuisine for everyone.

S.FORM: Mazima amin taisis'aan isia qudasnau'az tu babalivan, madia bunun mabaliv dauqpuut siin pa'isaz tikis, madia bunun tanam ma'un isiata sinpit'ia mahansum tu pan'ai'an.
S.TRANSL: 大家很喜歡奶奶的攤位，辣椒和車輪茄很多人買，許多人來品嘗她煮的菜餚。
Everyone loved my grandmother's stall. Many people bought the chilis and African eggplants, and many people came to taste the dishes she cooked.

S.FORM: Isiata sinhanat tu li'li' siin sinpit'ia tu maduq qaising qai mastaan tu manambuq kaunun, haizang makusia qaimus sinhanat maivanis tu titi, madia taisis'aan tis'uni kaihansuman minsuma, ihaan amin inaam babalivan tu tanangaus maldailaz.
S.TRANSL: 她煮的蕨菜和糯米飯非常好吃，還有用山豬肉煮的馬告滷肉，味道吸引了很多客人，大家都來我們攤位排隊。
The ferns and sticky rice she cooked were delicious, as well as the braised pork with maqaw pepper and wild boar meat. The flavors attracted many customers, and everyone lined up at our stall.

S.FORM: Maaq tu mahanat a qudasnau'az qai, ihaan azak dingalan malhanu ki minisuma tu taisis'aan, ihaan azak dingalan tusqit luluklas tupa tu, “Kain'anakan zami ka sanglavun sinsuaz, masihal a sintal'ia, kavavaa'a mun'iti mabaliv!”
S.TRANSL: all-natural and organic! Come and buy now!\""
While my grandmother was cooking, I was on the side attracting customers. I shouted, \The vegetables are self-grown

S.FORM: Mahaipi inaam isbaliv tu sanglav pit'aminun mabaliv, tupa qudasnau'az tu, “Tis'uni amin haiza isuu tu sin'indangaz.”
S.TRANSL: 我們的東西很快就賣完了，奶奶說：「都是因為有你的幫忙。」
Our goods sold out quickly, and my grandmother said, \It's all thanks to your help.\""

S.FORM: Maaq a sinkuzakuzakun qai, mapinqansiapin zaku pali'uni Takisilazan miniqumis tu sinsusuaz siin kakaunun tu kaiqansiapan, musasuu tu matlazin maqansiap malkasia babalivan sinkuzakuza tu iniqdi'an.
S.TRANSL: 這個活動，我學到了有關原住民植物和食品的知識，並且體驗到了擺攤的辛苦。
Through this event, I learned about indigenous plants and food and experienced the hard work of running a stall.

S.FORM: Sadu'an zaku qudasnau'az haiza'an malkasia itu qabas Takisilazan miniqumis kakaunun tu kaibaqisan is'aang, mastaan azak matunahip matumasqing.
S.TRANSL: 看到了奶奶對傳統食物的熱愛，我感到非常高興和榮幸。
Seeing my grandmother's passion for traditional food, I feel very proud and honored.
